image.altText: A man with a blue apron stands in a room full of packaged chocolate

props.synopsis: Small businesses working over the busy Easter period are counting the cost of rising prices, global economic uncertainty and customers who are becoming more frugal.

title.children: Small businesses feel the pinch amid busy Easter period

image.altText: A drone shot of a crash at a highway intersection. Grey smoke is billowing from the two trucks surrounded by police cars

props.synopsis: A South Australian truck driver has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal truck crash. Police are urging any witnesses to speak with investigators.

title.children: Truck driver arrested after fatal crash on South Australian highway

image.altText: Ladybirds gathered on dry grass with others behind on the ground

props.synopsis: Dry but cool conditions in South Australia's south east are causing ladybirds to gather in huge numbers, which an ecologist says will help control a destructive plant pest.

title.children: Millions of ladybirds descend on SA town to eat pine tree pest

image.altText: Statue holding the scales of justice (Reuters)

props.synopsis: The controversial law of sacrilege — which carries the same maximum penalty of life in jail as murder — still exists in South Australia, but some say it shouldn't.

title.children: An SA man faces life in prison for sacrilege. What does the controversial charge mean?

image.altText: Five boys play kabaddi wearing red shorts and no shirt on a sports oval.

props.synopsis: Junior players of a traditional Indian sport are allowed to compete at the Australian Sikh Games for the first time in the event's 37-year history.

title.children: Youngsters to compete in ancient sport for first time at Sikh games

image.altText: People wait to board a train pulling into a station.

props.synopsis: Adelaide public transport users continue to pay maximum fares for short trips three years after Labor returned to government, despite its former treasury spokesperson labelling it a "blatant cash-grab" when the Liberal party axed it in 2019.

title.children: No return to two-section fares in Adelaide despite 'cash grab' claims

image.altText: A farmer stands on a piece of rusted machinery in the middle of a farm

props.synopsis: Despite applying for government drought funding months ago, one South Australian farmer says he is still waiting for assistance.

title.children: Farmer waits on drought relief payments for months

image.altText: Two firefighters stand on a creek bed with a fire hose jetting into the creek. They are surrounded by blackened trees and grass,

props.synopsis: Authorities warn South Australians to be vigilant about fire safety over Easter. Meanwhile, beachgoers are urged to check local conditions as an algal bloom continues to impact parts of the coast.

title.children: Easter travellers warned of fire danger, algal bloom

image.altText: Sebastian Johnston is grinning

props.synopsis: After waking from a week-long induced coma, Sebastian Johnston was diagnosed with epilepsy and an acquired brain injury. Now he is calling for more understanding for young people living with the condition.

title.children: People living with epilepsy can 'slip through the cracks', advocates say

image.altText: Willie Rioli carries two football bags at training

props.synopsis: Port coach Ken Hinkley labels racist abuse directed towards Willie Rioli as "a disgrace", as the Power forward returns to training after being granted a day off.

title.children: Rioli returns to Port as coach labels racist attacks an 'absolute disgrace'

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: Matthew Draganoff is standing trial accused of the shooting murder of his tenant, Simon Middleton. Prosecutors allege there had been an "accumulation of grievances" that led to the crime.

title.children: Man allegedly murdered tenant over 'growing animosity', jury told

image.altText: A QantasLink plane on the tarmac

props.synopsis: Passengers out of SA's biggest regional city could soon see a spike in flight prices as more airports are forced to bring in security screening.

title.children: Mount Gambier airport passengers face 'unsustainable' $90 fare hike

image.altText: Stella  hugs her daughter as they walk along the footpath outside the District Court

props.synopsis: A woman who was abused at the hands of her ex-partner – a former police detective – says she felt "silenced" after reaching out to SA Police, a court has heard. Their daughter also recounted his abuse and said she no longer considered him her father.

title.children: 'I will not be silenced': Woman confronts abusive ex-cop husband in court

image.altText: Two men sitting at a table with one reaching out a hand to the other

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has hit back at Democrat Senator Chris Van Hollen for meeting with Kilmar Abrego Garcia and insists he will not facilitate Garcia's return from El Salvador, despite the US Supreme Court directing him to.

title.children: Trump hits back at US Senator Van Hollen for visit with Abrego Garcia

image.altText: a bald man wearing glasses speaking in front of an australian flag

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says he wants to see more Australians start new businesses under a Coalition federal government.

title.children: Coalition sets target to grow number of small businesses by 350,000

image.altText: Reflection in museum

props.synopsis: Jack joined a social media group to find peer connection. But when he suggested posters could be "a bit misogynistic" the harassment started.

title.children: 'Objectifying women as a starting point': Inside a controversial men-only support group

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater stands outside her house.

props.synopsis: It's April 7 — a week since Thargomindah's levee broke, and nearly the entire township was inundated — and Melinda Byrne is finally returning to her flood-damaged home. A call to her insurance company was even more heartbreaking than the sight of her destroyed possessions.

title.children: Call to insurer even worse than sight of this flood-damaged home

image.altText: Planks of processed timber stacked on metal shelves for in a giant hardware store.

props.synopsis: Do you know where the timber in your local hardware store comes from? The

title.children: Opposition vows to put country of origin stamp on your back deck

image.altText: NSW Police and Fire and Rescue NSW crews at Welfare Avenue, Beverley Hills after a car was set alight

props.synopsis: Five armed men, dressed in black kidnapped a mother from her family home in Bankstown while her two sons watched on, with the younger one also subjected to violence.

title.children: Police believe Sydney mother of two and kidnapping victim to be body in burnt-out car

image.altText: marco rubio in paris

props.synopsis: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says the US will not "continue with this endeavour for weeks and months on end".

title.children: US will abandon Ukraine peace talks in 'matter of days' if no progress

image.altText: Image of deceased sheep along a fenceline.

props.synopsis: Western Queensland graziers are facing devastating livestock losses, with an estimated half a million cattle, sheep and goats dead and a tough road to recovery still ahead.

title.children: Livestock losses across western Queensland reach catastrophic levels

image.altText: The Colosseum in Rome illuminated at night with a large, lit cross in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis misses the Good Friday procession, after nearly dying during a five-week bout with double pneumonia.

title.children: Pope misses Good Friday procession, Vatican yet to confirm other appearances

image.altText: A satellite image showing ex-Tropical Cycline Errol shortly after it crossed WA's Kimberley coast.

props.synopsis: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Errol hits the Kimberley coast as a tropical low, bringing potential heavy rainfall as the system moves inland in Western Australia's far north.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Errol crosses WA coast with warnings for heavy rainfall

image.altText: a lighthouse with large waves

props.synopsis: Authorities have urged people to exercise caution around the water during a warm Easter weekend, after multiple drownings across the east coast on Good Friday.

title.children: Four dead, two missing after Good Friday drownings at east coast beaches

image.altText: A young Heath Ledger in the 1999 gritty urban crime thriller Two Hands.

props.synopsis: From real-life stories to new comedies, ditch that $20-per-month streaming service and let us introduce to you the best of film and TV you can watch right now without paying a cent.

title.children: Sick of paying for streaming services? These films and TV series are free

image.altText: Peter Wright pumps his fist in celebration as a West Coast player looks disappointed

props.synopsis: Essendon has come from behind to post a two-point win over West Coast, but ruckman Sam Draper appeared to suffer an Achilles tendon injury early in the final quarter.

title.children: Bombers' two-point AFL win over Eagles soured by Draper injury, Blues thrash Kangaroos by 82 points

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Prabowo Subianto shake hands in front of Indonesian and Russian flags

props.synopsis: While 70 per cent of Australians surveyed hold a "very unfavourable" view of Russia, that's only the case for 6 per cent of Indonesians.

title.children: Russian aircraft in Indonesia 'should not concern us', says expert

image.altText: Cam Green raises his bat with his right hand

props.synopsis: After eight months on the sidelines, Australia's star all-rounder makes a triumphant return to cricket by scoring an unbeaten century for English county side Gloucestershire.

title.children: Green 'proud' after scoring century in first match since back surgery

image.altText: A close up of a Hesta sign on a wall.

props.synopsis: HESTA won't process super contributions, regular withdraws, investment switches and insurance claims until June, due to a system changeover. Consumer advocates and members have expressed concern about the freeze on funds.

title.children: One of Australia's biggest super funds is freezing services until June

image.altText: Claire Austin who was the victim of an alleged domestic violence attack holds a glass of wine while smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: NSW Police are continuing to investigate the death of Claire Austin, 38, in Sydney's east after she was injured trying to escape an alleged domestic violence incident.

title.children: Community mourns death of another alleged domestic violence victim

image.altText: Marolon stands on a grassy hill, facing the camera in a white button up and grass kirt. In the backdrop, a lake and mountains.

props.synopsis: One of New Zealand's most celebrated voices has embraced te reo Māori for his new album, arriving during a tumultuous time for Māori rights.

title.children: When Marlon Williams started writing in Māori, his music shifted

image.altText: Ramos Horta Timor leste reuters

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste's President Jose Ramos Horta has said his country's forces could join with China's as long as the activity is "not directed at any perceived hostile entity".

title.children: A close Australian neighbour is open to military drills with China

image.altText: Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton, now seriously on the back foot, has made an extraordinarily big "aspirational" commitment at the back end of this campaign.

title.children: Dutton's tax 'aspiration' is his most radical idea since nuclear power

image.altText: truck and rv parked on acreage near a creek

props.synopsis: Show-cause notices have been sent to property owners running small-scale campsites in Queensland's Scenic Rim, but they say the regulations are unfair and should only apply to tourist parks.

title.children: Farmers given show-cause notice for hosting campers without a permit

image.altText: An illustration of a scammer and a robot highfiving while popping out of a phone

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is a scammer's newest tool as experts warn they can generate fake photos, voice clones, phishing emails and fake websites “at an increasingly rapid rate”.

title.children: Microsoft says it blocks 1.6 million bots an hour as scammers latch onto AI
